result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to withdraw

1:32 PM Defendant Shane A. Radovan in court.  Attorney John E. German appeared by video for Shane A. Radovan.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.   Motion to withdraw filed by Atty German.  PD has been appointed in 22CF1141, but not assigned to this file yet.  DE to go to SPD today to have an counsel apptd to this file also.   Motion granted.  Adjmt granted for 22CF1141 to catch up.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
to Request to appear by Zoom or reschedule

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney German.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Attorney German states that he has not been retained on the new case yet.  Attorney German further states that he will table his motion to withdraw for now based on a conversation with the DE.  Final pre-trial set for 10/5/22 @ 1:30.
to Withdraw
to Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney German.   Clerk HMcBride.  Offer received and Atty German needs time to discuss with DE.  Adjmt granted. FPT 8/22 2pm. Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney German.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE has new charges scheduled for PH on 4/19. This matter adjourned to allow new case to catch up. PTC 6/23 9am.  Bond continued.
